newsitem.title: USA: Ohio treas picks financial adviser for debt issues.
newsitem.headline: Ohio treas picks financial adviser for debt issues.

text.p: Ohio Treasurer J. Kenneth Blackwell announced Friday that Municipal Advisory Partners Inc. has been retained to serve as financial adviser on all debt issuances from the state treasury from May 1, 1997 through Jue 30, 1998.
The state treasury has increased its volume, complexity and type of debt issuances since Blackwell became treasurer in 1994 and needs a consistent internal policy, Blackwell said in a news release.
Municipal Advisory Partners Inc. is a female and minority-owned firm based in Montclair, N.J., chosen through competitive bidding, Blackwell added.

They have also served as financial adviser to the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency, the Ohio Underground Storage Tank Compensation and Release Board, the Ohio Building Authority and the Ohio Public Facilities Commission.
